00173   class Exception;
00174 
00175   // Helpers to render a exception message a la IO manipulators
00176   struct ExceptionMessageRenderer {
00177     ExceptionMessageRenderer(const Exception &e) : ex(e) { }
00178 
00179     std::ostream &render(std::ostream &out) const;
00180 
00181     const Exception &ex;
00182   };
00183 
00184   struct ExceptionMessagesRenderer {
00185     ExceptionMessagesRenderer(const Exception &e, const char *sep = ": ")
00186       : ex(e), separator(sep) { }
00187 
00188     std::ostream &render(std::ostream &out) const;
00189 
00190     const Exception &ex;
00191     const char *separator;
00192   };
00193 
00198   class Exception : public std::runtime_error {
00199     const Exception &operator=(const Exception &); // not assignable
00200 
00201     int m_error;
00202     int m_line;
00203     const char *m_func;
00204     const char *m_file;
00205 
00206   public:
00207     typedef std::runtime_error Parent;
00208 
00209     Exception(int error, int l = 0, const char *fn = 0, const char *fl = 0)
00210       : Parent(""), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl), prev(0)
00211       { }
00212     Exception(int error, const String &msg, int l = 0, const char *fn = 0,
00213               const char *fl = 0)
00214       : Parent(msg), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl), prev(0)
00215       { }
00216     Exception(int error, const String &msg, const Exception &ex,
00217               int l = 0, const char *fn = 0, const char *fl = 0)
00218       : Parent(msg), m_error(error), m_line(l), m_func(fn), m_file(fl),
00219         prev(new Exception(ex)) { }
00220     // copy ctor is required for exceptions
00221     Exception(const Exception &ex) : Parent(ex), m_error(ex.m_error),
00222         m_line(ex.m_line), m_func(ex.m_func), m_file(ex.m_file) {
00223       prev = ex.prev ? new Exception(*ex.prev) : 0;
00224     }
00225     ~Exception() throw() { delete prev; prev = 0; }
00226 
00227     int code() const { return m_error; }
00228     int line() const { return m_line; }
00229     const char *func() const { return m_func; }
00230     const char *file() const { return m_file; }
00231 
00232     // render message
00233     virtual std::ostream &render_message(std::ostream &out) const {
00234       return out << what(); // override for custom exceptions
00235     }
00236 
00237     // render messages for the entire exception chain
00238     virtual std::ostream &
00239     render_messages(std::ostream &out, const char *sep) const;
00240 
00241     ExceptionMessageRenderer message() const {
00242       return ExceptionMessageRenderer(*this);
00243     }
00244 
00245     ExceptionMessagesRenderer messages(const char *sep = ": ") const {
00246       return ExceptionMessagesRenderer(*this, sep);
00247     }
00248 
00249     Exception *prev;    // exception chain/list
00250   };
00251 
00252 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, const Exception &);
00253 
00254 inline std::ostream &
00255 ExceptionMessageRenderer::render(std::ostream &out) const {
00256   return ex.render_message(out);
00257 }
00258 
00259 inline std::ostream &
00260 ExceptionMessagesRenderer::render(std::ostream &out) const {
00261   return ex.render_messages(out, separator);
00262 }
00263 
00264 inline std::ostream &
00265 operator<<(std::ostream &out, const ExceptionMessageRenderer &r) {
00266   return r.render(out);
00267 }
00268 
00269 inline std::ostream &
00270 operator<<(std::ostream &out, const ExceptionMessagesRenderer &r) {
00271   return r.render(out);
00272 }
00273 
00277 #define HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, _msg_) \
00278   Exception(_code_, _msg_, __LINE__, HT_FUNC, __FILE__)
00279 
00280 #define HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_) \
00281   Exception(_code_, _msg_, _ex_, __LINE__, HT_FUNC, __FILE__)
00282 
00283 #define HT_THROW(_code_, _msg_) throw HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, _msg_)
00284 #define HT_THROW_(_code_) HT_THROW(_code_, "")
00285 #define HT_THROW2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_) throw HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, _msg_)
00286 #define HT_THROW2_(_code_, _ex_) HT_THROW2(_code_, _ex_, "")
00287 
00288 #define HT_THROWF(_code_, _fmt_, ...) \
00289   throw HT_EXCEPTION(_code_, format(_fmt_, __VA_ARGS__))
00290 
00291 #define HT_THROW2F(_code_, _ex_, _fmt_, ...) \
00292   throw HT_EXCEPTION2(_code_, _ex_, format(_fmt_, __VA_ARGS__))
00293 
00294 #define HT_RETHROWF(_fmt_, ...) \
00295   catch (Exception &e) { HT_THROW2F(e.code(), e, _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); } \
00296   catch (std::bad_alloc &e) { \
00297     HT_THROWF(Error::BAD_MEMORY_ALLOCATION, _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); \
00298   } \
00299   catch (std::exception &e) { \
00300     HT_THROWF(Error::EXTERNAL, "caught std::exception: %s " _fmt_,  e.what(), \
00301               __VA_ARGS__); \
00302   } \
00303   catch (...) { \
00304     HT_ERRORF("caught unknown exception " _fmt_, __VA_ARGS__); \
00305     throw; \
00306   }
00307 
00308 #define HT_RETHROW(_s_) HT_RETHROWF("%s", _s_)
00309 #define HT_RETHROW_ HT_RETHROW("")
00310 
00311 #define HT_TRY(_s_, _code_) do { \
00312   try { _code_; } \
00313   HT_RETHROW(_s_) \
00314 } while (0)
00315
